intro: Rhodiola alsia, commonly known as the alpine rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cold, rocky environments. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to store water and nutrients efficiently, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Rhodiola alsia is also valued for its potential adaptogenic properties, making it a subject of interest in herbal medicine.
